Additional Allowance for Having Minor Children
Under
Public Law (PL) 108-454
,
38 U.S.C. 1311(f)
authorizes a monthly DIC child supplement payment to certain surviving spouses.
A monthly child supplement will be paid in addition to the regular DIC payment, if the surviving spouse
is receiving DIC
has one or more children under the age of 18 on the DIC award, and
has not received DIC for more than two years from the date of the original entitlement to DIC.
Note
: The earliest date that the monthly child supplement may be added to a DIC award is January 1, 2005, the first of the month after the date of enactment of
PL 108-454
.
